title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.1: EDUCATION SYSTEM MANAGEMENTAND ACCOUNTABILITY

description.narrative: By 2024, education institutions and stakeholders have an improved education management system and accountability, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, more children (5â€“17 years), especially adolescent girls, acquire competencies through access to quality and inclusive learning.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, education institutions and stakeholders have an improved education management system and accountability

description.narrative: In 2021, some statistical documents were produced and made available to actors. These included the development and dissemination of a leaflet entitled ";les enjeux de; l’éducation en RDC: priorités sur les filles", a leaflet on the synthesis of statistical data for 2020, and a MICS-EAGLE factsheet. The office also supported the production of statistical data for 2021 by taking charge of data entry and processing operations. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2021
